item.title: テンセント・ミュージック、第1四半期の売上高は前年同期比3.4％減の9億3700万ドル、利益は同27.5％増の2億1200万ドル、音楽配信収入は同39.2％増の5億100万ドル、有料ユーザー数は1億1350万人（Priyanka.G/ロイター）
item.description:
Priyanka.G / Reuters:
Tencent Music reports Q1 revenue down 3.4% YoY to $937M, profit up 27.5% YoY to $212M, music subscription revenue up 39.2% YoY to $501M, and 113.5M paying users  —  China's Tencent Music Entertainment Group (1698.HK), beat first-quarter revenue estimates on Monday, helped by steady growth …

item.title: 多くの学生デモ参加者は、欧米の主要メディアがガザへのアクセスに苦労している中、アルジャジーラの現地取材を高く評価していると言う（Santul Nerkar/New York Times）
item.description:
Santul Nerkar / New York Times:
Many student protesters say they value Al Jazeera's on-the-ground coverage, as many major Western media outlets have struggled to gain access to Gaza  —  Students active in campus protests value Al Jazeera's on-the-ground coverage and its perspective on the Israel-Hamas war.

item.title: 英国の風刺・調査雑誌『プライベート・アイ』の編集長を38年間務めたイアン・ヒスロップに、編集の特権、印刷物であることなどについてインタビュー（Bron Maher/Press Gazette）。
item.description:
Bron Maher / Press Gazette:
An interview with Ian Hislop, editor of UK satirical and investigative magazine Private Eye for 38 years, on the privilege of editing, being in print, and more  —  “When I was told I was being given an award I thought, ‘Oh, shit, damages.’”  —  Private Eye editor Ian Hislop has told …

item.title: ハンターブルック・メディアの発行元が、最近ハンターブルックの批判記事の対象となったライバル企業の株式保有を公表しなかった（Max Tani/Semafor）
item.description:
Max Tani / Semafor:
Hunterbrook Media's publisher failed to disclose its ownership stake in a rival to a company that was recently the subject of a critical Hunterbrook article  —  The Scoop  —  The publisher and co-founder of Hunterbrook Media, the startup newsroom whose affiliate places stock market bets …

item.title: 情報筋アップル、ハリウッドのタレント代表と会談し、新たな成果報酬制度を提案、アマゾンやネットフリックスも同様の計画に着手（Lucas Shaw/Bloomberg）
item.description:
Lucas Shaw / Bloomberg:
Sources: Apple has met with Hollywood talent representatives to propose a new performance-based compensation regime, as Amazon and Netflix work on similar plans  —  Apple builds a bonus system around sign-ups, viewer loyalty and production costs.  —  Good afternoon from 30,000 feet.

item.title: 英国のニュースメディア協会は書簡で、広告をブロックする「ウェブ消しゴム」ツールを課すことはジャーナリズムの財政的持続可能性を脅かすとアップルに警告している（Financial Times）。
item.description:
Financial Times:
In a letter, the UK's News Media Association warns Apple that imposing a “web eraser” tool to block ads would threaten journalism's financial sustainability  —  UK press says proposed ‘web eraser’ tool in next iOS update threatens journalism's financial sustainability

item.title: 2011年からニュースレター「Wake Up To Politics」を執筆している22歳のゲイブ・フライシャーは、大学卒業後に事業を拡大する予定だ（ジョージタウン大学）
item.description:
Georgetown University:
Gabe Fleisher, the 22-year-old who has been writing the Wake Up To Politics newsletter since 2011, plans to expand his business after graduating from college  —  At the 2023 White House Correspondents' Dinner, the night's headliner, comedian Roy Wood Jr., brought Gabe Fleisher (C'24) as a special guest.

item.title: 4つの独立系学生新聞の編集者が、大きなプレッシャーと全国的なスポットライトを浴びながら、米国のキャンパス・デモをどのように取材してきたかを語る（Sophie Culpepper/Nieman Lab）。
item.description:
Sophie Culpepper / Nieman Lab:
Editors from four independent student newspapers discuss how they have approached covering US campus protests under immense pressure and a national spotlight  —  “We don't come in when there's something crazy happening and then leave when it's over.  This is just what we do all the time.

item.title: YouTubeのBrandcastを前に、3人のトップクリエイターが、テレビで視聴される洗練されたコンテンツの制作と、YouTubeがどのように彼らとオーディエンスを大規模に結びつけるかについて語った（Alex Weprin/The Hollywood Reporter）。
item.description:
Alex Weprin / The Hollywood Reporter:
Ahead of YouTube's Brandcast, three top creators talk about producing polished content to be viewed on TVs and how YouTube connects them with audiences at scale  —  As YouTube closes in on one year atop the Nielsen Gauge charts, some of its top creators weigh in on why the platform has become bigger than Netflix on TV sets.

item.title: 毎月4時間のエピソードで成功企業のケーススタディを提供するポッドキャスト「アクワイアード」が、C-suiteや副社長クラスのエグゼクティブの間で人気となった理由（Ben Cohen/Wall Street Journal）
item.description:
Ben Cohen / Wall Street Journal:
How Acquired, a podcast that offers case studies of successful companies in monthly four-hour episodes, became a favorite among C-suite and VP-level executives  —  How did Acquired become the business world's favorite show?  —  It's a wonky podcast about business history and strategy with four-hour episodes that drop once a month.

item.title: Foxによると、Tubiの第3四半期のMAUは8,000万人、前年同期の6,700万人から増加、売上は前年同期比22％増、総視聴時間は前年同期比36％増、うち90％がオンデマンドによるもの（David Satin/The Streamable）。
item.description:
David Satin / The Streamable:
Fox reports Tubi had ~80M MAUs in Q3, up from 67M in Q3 2023, revenue up 22% YoY, and a 36% YoY increase in total view time, 90% of which comes from on-demand  —  Tubi finished Fox's fiscal third quarter just behind Disney+ in terms of total TV viewing time, and may continue to climb.

item.title: 電子メール：犯人はWPPのマーク・リードCEOをターゲットに、音声クローンとYouTubeの公開映像を使って幹部とのビデオ会議をセットアップするディープフェイク詐欺を仕掛ける（Daniel Thomas/Financial Times）
item.description:
Daniel Thomas / Financial Times:
Email: criminals target WPP CEO Mark Read in a deepfake scam by using a voice clone and public YouTube footage to set up a video meeting with his executives  —  Mark Read says criminals set up Microsoft Teams call with senior executives in unsuccessful attack

item.title: 検閲をかわすためにYouTubeを利用したインドのジャーナリストたちによると、YouTubeは政府の通達を理由に、自分たちのニュースチャンネルを禁止したり、廃止したりしている（Raksha Kumar/Reuters Institute）。
item.description:
Raksha Kumar / Reuters Institute:
Some Indian journalists who turned to YouTube to dodge censorship say the company is banning or demonetizing their news channels, citing government notices  —  As the country votes in this year's crucial election, news channels are being banned or demonetised in a move criticised by press freedom groups

item.title: トークラジオ局WABCがルディ・ジュリアーニを停職処分にし、毎日の番組をキャンセル。
item.description:
Nicholas Fandos / New York Times:
Talk radio station WABC suspends Rudy Giuliani and cancels his daily show, saying he broke rules by trying to discuss discredited claims about 2020's election  —  The station's owner, John Catsimatidis, a Republican billionaire, said he suspended the former mayor for persisting in talking …

item.title: 5月11日のユーロビジョン・ファイナルを前に、イスラエル・ガザ紛争をめぐる緊張が、政治的中立性を維持しようとする主催者の努力を複雑にしている（Louis Staples/Rolling Stone）。
item.description:
Louis Staples / Rolling Stone:
Ahead of the Eurovision finals on May 11, tensions over the Israel-Gaza war complicate the organizers' efforts to maintain an appearance of political neutrality  —  At the glittery, eccentric spectacle, controversy and protests about Israel's inclusion overshadow the music.  Can the contest ever be apolitical?
